Operation 'DeleteCustomerProfile' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description is too minimal. It lacks information about: what data entity is affected (CL), what the permanent nature of deletion means, what response to expect, and the permission requirements. Enhanced description provides context about the CL entity, clarifies irreversibility, specifies the HTTP response, and mentions permission requirements for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Deletes a customer profile.
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a customer profile from the CL (Customer) data entity. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Full access to all documents or Master Data administrator role). This operation removes the entire customer record and cannot be undone. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion, or 403 if insufficient permissions.
data.reasoning: The current description is too minimal. It lacks information about: what data entity is affected (CL), what the permanent nature of deletion means, what response to expect, and the permission requirements. Enhanced description provides context about the CL entity, clarifies irreversibility, specifies the HTTP response, and mentions permission requirements for better AI agent decision-making.

Accepts address details such as street, number, city, state, and postal code as defined in the createUpdateAddressRequests schema. data.current_description: Creates a new document with an ID automatically generated by VTEX, corresponding to a given data entity. The request body is a JSON object where the key is the name of the field.
data.summary_suggestion: Create new document with auto-generated ID
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new document in the specified data entity with a system-generated unique ID. Accepts a JSON object where keys are field names and values conform to the entity's defined field types (Boolean, Currency, Date, Email, Integer, Text, Varchar, Relationship, etc.). Returns a 201 response with the created document ID and href. The document is immediately persisted and searchable in Master Data.

data.current_description: Creates a partial document, sending only some of the fields.
data.summary_suggestion: Create or update document with partial fields
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new document or updates an existing document by sending only a subset of fields. If no document ID exists, a new document is created with an auto-generated ID. If a document with the same ID exists, only the provided fields are updated while other fields remain unchanged. Accepts a JSON object with field names as keys. Returns 201 status with document ID and href. Useful for partial updates without requiring the complete document structure.
data.reasoning: Original summary is incomplete - it doesn't mention the update capability. Description is vague about the create-or-update behavior and lacks output details. data.current_summary: Create document with custom ID or update entire document
data.current_description: Creates a new document with a custom ID, or updates an entire document if there is already a document with the informed ID.
data.summary_suggestion: Create or replace document with specified ID
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new document with a custom-specified ID, or completely replaces an existing document if one with that ID already exists. Accepts a JSON object where keys are field names conforming to defined field types. All fields in the request body will be persisted; any fields not included will be removed or reset. Returns the document ID and href. This is a full replacement operation - use PATCH for partial updates instead.
data.reasoning: Summary is accurate but could be more concise. Description lacks clarity about the replacement behavior (fields not in request are removed) and missing output details. data.current_description:
Saves a file in a field of type `File`. Learn more about [Data entity field types](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/creating-data-entity--tutorials_1265#understanding-the-types).

> You can upload more than one file. Just add a new field in the `form-data` with type `File`.
data.description_suggestion: Uploads one or more files to a File-type field in a Master Data document. Accepts multiple files via form-data with type `File`. Returns the attachment metadata including file identifiers. Files are persisted in the document's specified field and can be retrieved later using the attachment retrieval endpoint.
data.reasoning: The current description explains what the operation does and mentions multiple file support, but lacks clarity on what is returned and the persistence/side effects of the operation. Added information about return values and state changes to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's outcomes.

data.current_description:

data.description_suggestion: Checks whether a specific document belongs to one or more defined clusters in Master Data. Accepts a request body specifying cluster identifiers to validate against. data.current_description: Deletes a document.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete a Master Data document permanently
data.description_suggestion: Permanently removes a document from the specified data entity. This operation is irreversible and will delete all associated data. Attempting to delete a non-existent document will result in a 404 error.

data.current_description: Lists all versions of a document.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a complete history of all versions for a specified document in a data entity. Each version represents a state change of the document. Returns a list of version objects containing version identifiers, timestamps, and metadata. Useful for auditing document changes or reverting to previous states. Requires read-level permissions or higher.

data.current_description: Updates the version of a document.
data.summary_suggestion: Restore document to a previous version
data.description_suggestion: Restores a document to a previous version state by applying the specified version as the current document state. This operation creates a new version that mirrors the historical version's data. The current document is updated with all fields from the target version. Returns the updated document object. This is useful for reverting unwanted changes. Requires insert/update permissions.

data.current_description:
Retrieves a file that had been previously saved in a field of type `File`.

> Make sure to include the file extension in the name, like in this example: `/api/dataentities/CL/documents/123/file/attachments/image.png`.
data.description_suggestion: Downloads a file attachment previously saved in a File-type field of a document. Returns the binary file content with appropriate content-type headers. The file name must include the file extension (e.g., image.png, document.pdf). Useful for retrieving user-uploaded files, documents, or media associated with Master Data records. Requires read-level permissions or higher.
